FuncDef:
The pim timer hello command sets an interval at which a PIM interface sends Hello messages.
The undo pim timer hello command restores the default setting. The pim timer hello command sets an interval at which a PIM interface sends Hello messages. The undo pim timer hello command restores the default setting. By default, a PIM interface sends Hello messages at an interval of 30 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval at which a PIM interface sends Hello messages.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 18000, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: A Router on a PIM-SM network needs to send Hello messages periodically to maintain PIM neighbor relationships. To set the interval at which an interface sends Hello messages, run the pim timer hello command.
